subject: Sales
title: The Live Product Demo
description: One-minute skill: The Live Product Demo.

hook.text: Gates demoed Windows 98 live on stage. It crashed. Blue screen. Millions watching. Total nightmare.

buildup.text: Live demos are high-risk, high-reward. Nothing is more convincing than seeing the product work live.

discovery.text: Control the environment: pre-loaded data, tested connections, and a rehearsed click path are essential.

twist.text: The urge to show every feature kills demos. Show only what solves the buyer's specific problem.

climax.text: Demo the pain point first, then the relief. Let the buyer feel the transformation in real time.

punchline.text: Show the pain, then the cure. Live and in person.

quiz.question: What is the biggest mistake in live product demos?
options: Trying to show every feature instead of focusing on the buyer's problem
